sections: Have you ever seen a more head turning 911?
was purchased originally in 1996, by the current owner. Included with the car are a clean Carfax report and Oregon title, making it a wonderful find for any car enthusiast.
with a Folger Styling slant-nose body kit, as well as 964-style tail lights, side mirrors, front marker lights, and a 964-style bumper.

example up for grabs also has an enormous Folger Styling spoiler sitting on the back of the tear-drop back end as well as many vents scattered throughout the exterior of the vehicle. On the exterior, you’ll notice a striking and unique white paint, which contrasts against the luscious brown leather seats and brown carpet.

Power is supplied by Porsche’s well-renowned 3.0-liter straight-six, mated to a five-speed trans-axle manual transmission. Combined with 18-inch alloy Folger wheels, supplying shape to Hankook Ventus V12 Evo2 tires to ensure grip at high speeds. All of that is wrapped up with four-wheel ventilated disk brakes allowing you to stop on a dime.

has also gone through recent maintenance fixing or replacing many of the internals such as new spark plugs, valve adjustment, replacement valve cover gasket, as well as a new battery. A Bosch K-jetronic fuel injection system has also been serviced allowing for a perfectly running engine and a wonderful driving experience.

Porsche’s iconic 911 is highly regarded as one of the most exhilarating and unique driving experiences of any sports car of its time. The problem is that it is virtually impossible to find a reasonably priced well-running example of these cars. With this Porsche 911SC, you get a beautifully crafted vehicle with an astonishing slant-nose body kit, rear spoiler, and vents. To top all of that the bidding for this car, up until this point, has been relatively low. That makes this car a rare example of an amazing car at a reasonably low price.
